headline: Gold Closes Out Volatile Week on Higher Note
summary: PRECIOUS METALS 1604 ET – Gold futures have finished higher for seven out of the past nine weeks — with the front-month contract settling the week up 5% to $4,951.20 a troy ounce. For the day, gold finishes up 1.

headline: 5 Securities & Exchanges Stocks to Watch Amid Increased Volatility
summary: Zacks Securities and Exchanges industry players like SPGI, ICE, CME, NDAQ and CBOE gain from rising crypto adoption, trading volumes, a higher non-trading revenue base and tech investments.

headline: Asian and American Inflows Support Gold Uptick
summary: Gold futures rose in morning trade. January’s uptick in prices was supported by strong inflows into ETFs by investors in both the U.S. and Asia, the World Gold Council said.

raw.headline: Asian and American Inflows Support Gold Uptick
raw.summary: Gold futures rose in morning trade. January’s uptick in prices was supported by strong inflows into ETFs by investors in both the U.S. and Asia, the World Gold Council said.

headline: Pelican Bay Capital Management Sold CME Group (CME) in Q4
summary: Pelican Bay Capital Management (PBCM), an investment management company, released its fourth-quarter 2025 investor letter. A copy of the letter can be downloaded here. PBCM Concentrated Value Strategy returned 8.5% in the quarter, compared to a 3.8% return for the Russell 1000 Value Index. The robust performance of AI-related stocks and commodities exposure drove the […]

headline: Copper Set for Weekly Loss But Fundamentals Still Strong
summary: Copper was headed for a weekly loss on signs of weaker demand, though fundamentals remained strong, with China increasing grid and energy infrastructure investment.

raw.headline: Copper Set for Weekly Loss But Fundamentals Still Strong

headline: Exchange Giant CME Raises Gold, Silver Margins as Volatility Persists
summary: The leading operator of derivatives exchanges again increased margin requirements for gold and silver futures contracts, a move designed to reduce market risk.

raw.headline: Exchange Giant CME Raises Gold, Silver Margins as Volatility Persists

headline: Gold Holds Below $5,000 as Volatility Remains High, Exchange Operator CME Hikes Margins
summary: Gold prices remained below $5,000 as volatility remains high following last week's historic rout, with exchange operator CME Group raising margin requirements for precious metals once again. Futures in New York ticked 0.
